property.name: mediadisplayblurb
property.value: Women waiting to vote in Pakistan

note.text: Men and women in Pakistan lead largely separate lives. Women have lower status than men everywhere, and many women are kept in seclusion, or "purdah." However, poorer women are rarely kept in purdah because they must work.

The norms of purdah may be stronger outside the immediate community. Women may be expected to veil themselves completely when interacting with outsiders, but have more liberty in their local community.
